016package squidpony.squidmath;
017
018import squidpony.annotation.GwtIncompatible;
019
020import java.io.Serializable;
021import java.util.*;
022
023/**
024 * An int-key and int-value insertion-ordered hash map with with a fast implementation, originally from fastutil as
025 * Object2ObjectLinkedOpenHashMap but modified (in {@link OrderedMap}) to support constant-time indexed access of keys,
026 * values, and entries, and reordering. Deletion is slower with this algorithm (O(n) because the array used to keep
027 * track of ordering and indexing only allows linear-time deletion, instead of a linked-list approach allowing
028 * constant-time deletion but not helping at all with indexed access), and insertion sometimes takes longer than an
029 * ordered map using a linked-list for order because rehashing is more expensive. The benefits from constant-time access
030 * by index are numerous, especially for games, since fetching a random element becomes O(1) instead of O(n), and the
031 * index can be used to store extra info for no cost.
032 * <br>
033 * Instances of this class use a hash table to represent a map. The table is filled up to a specified <em>load factor</em>, and then doubled in size to accommodate new entries. If the table is
034 * emptied below <em>one fourth</em> of the load factor, it is halved in size. However, halving is not performed when deleting entries from an iterator, as it would interfere with the iteration
035 * process.
036 * <br>
037 * Note that {@link #clear()} does not modify the hash table size. Rather, a family of {@linkplain #trim() trimming methods} lets you control the size of the table; this is particularly useful if
038 * you reuse instances of this class.
039 * <br>
040 * Iterators generated by this map will enumerate pairs in the same order in which they have been added to the map (addition of pairs whose key is already present in the set does not change the
041 * iteration order). Note that this order has nothing in common with the natural order of the keys. The order is kept by means of a int-specialized list, {@link IntVLA}, and is modifiable with this
042 * class' {@link #reorder(int...)} and {@link #shuffle(IRNG)} methods, among other tools. It may be preferable to avoid instantiating an Iterator object and instead
043 * use a normal int-based for loop with {@link #getAt(int)} called in each iteration. Though this doesn't allow easy deletion of items during iteration, it may be the
044 * fastest way to iterate through an OrderedMap.
045 * <br>
046 * This class allows approximately constant-time lookup of keys or values by their index in the ordering, which can
047 * allow some novel usage of the data structure. {@link OrderedSet} can be used like a list of unique elements, keeping
048 * order like a list does but also allowing rapid checks for whether an item exists in the OrderedSet, and OrderedMap
049 * can be used like that but with values associated as well (where OrderedSet uses contains(), OrderedMap uses
050 * containsKey()). You can also set the key and value at a position with {@link #putAt(int, int, int)}, or alter
051 * the key while keeping its value and index the same with {@link #alter(int, int)}. Reordering works here too,
052 * both with completely random orders from {@link #shuffle(IRNG)} or with a previously-generated ordering from
053 * {@link #reorder(int...)} (you can produce such an ordering for a given size and reuse it across multiple Ordered data
054 * structures with {@link IRNG#randomOrdering(int)}). Note that putAt() and {@link #removeAt(int)} do not run in constant
055 * time, and depending on the point of insertion/removal, they are likely to run in linear time (but also note that most
056 * insertion-ordered Maps and Sets don't allow insertion or removal at anywhere but the beginning or end of the order).
057 * <br>
058 * This doesn't allow custom IHashers because IHasher expects an Object to hash, and that would box the keys every time.
059 * <br>
060 * Thank you, Sebastiano Vigna, for making FastUtil available to the public with such high quality.
061 * <br>
062 * See https://github.com/vigna/fastutil for the original library.
063 * @author Sebastiano Vigna (responsible for all the hard parts)
064 * @author Tommy Ettinger (mostly responsible for squashing several layers of parent classes into one monster class)
065 */
066public class IntIntOrderedMap implements Serializable, Cloneable {
067    private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
068    /**
069     * The array of keys.
070     */
071    protected int[] key;
072    /**
073     * The array of values.
074     */
075    protected int[] value;
076    /**
077     * The mask for wrapping a position counter.
078     */
079    protected int mask;
080    /**
081     * Whether this set contains the key zero.
082     */
083    protected boolean containsNullKey;
084    /**
085     * An IntVLA (variable-length int sequence) that stores the positions in the key array of specific keys, with the
086     * positions in insertion order. The order can be changed with {@link #reorder(int...)} and other methods.
087     */
088    protected IntVLA order;
089    /**
090     * The current table size.
091     */
092    protected int n;
093    /**
094     * Threshold after which we rehash. It must be the table size times {@link #f}.
095     */
096    protected int maxFill;
097    /**
098     * Number of entries in the set (including the key zero, if present).
099     */
100    protected int size;
101    /**
102     * The acceptable load factor.
103     */
104    public final float f;
105    /**
106     * Cached set of entries.
107     */
108    protected volatile MapEntrySet entries;
109    /**
110     * Cached set of keys.
111     */
112    protected volatile KeySet keys;
113    /**
114     * Cached collection of values.
115     */
116    protected volatile ValueCollection values;
117    /**
118     * Default return value.
119     */
120    protected int defRetValue = -1;
121
122    /**
123     * The initial default size of a hash table.
124     */
125    public static final int DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE = 16;
126    /**
127     * The default load factor of a hash table.
128     */
129    public static final float DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR = .25f; // .1875f; // .75f;
130    /**
131     * The load factor for a (usually small) table that is meant to be particularly fast.
132     */
133    public static final float FAST_LOAD_FACTOR = .5f;
134    /**
135     * The load factor for a (usually very small) table that is meant to be extremely fast.
136     */
137    public static final float VERY_FAST_LOAD_FACTOR = .25f;
138
139    public void defaultReturnValue(final int rv) {
140        defRetValue = rv;
141    }
142
143    public int defaultReturnValue() {
144        return defRetValue;
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Creates a new OrderedMap.
149     * <p>
150     * <p>The actual table size will be the least power of two greater than <code>expected</code>/<code>f</code>.
151     *
152     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the hash set.
153     * @param f        the load factor.
154     */
155
156    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
157    public IntIntOrderedMap(final int expected, final float f) {
158        if (f <= 0 || f > 1)
159            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Load factor must be greater than 0 and smaller than or equal to 1");
160        if (expected < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The expected number of elements must be nonnegative");
161        this.f = f;
162        n = arraySize(expected, f);
163        mask = n - 1;
164        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
165        key = new int[n + 1];
166        value = new int[n + 1];
167        //link = new long[n + 1];
168        order = new IntVLA(expected);
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Creates a new OrderedMap with 0.75f as load factor.
173     *
174     * @param expected the expected number of elements in the OrderedMap.
175     */
176    public IntIntOrderedMap(final int expected) {
177        this(expected, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Creates a new OrderedMap with initial expected 16 entries and 0.75f as load factor.
182     */
183    public IntIntOrderedMap() {
184        this(DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Creates a new OrderedMap copying a given one.
189     *
190     * @param m a {@link Map} to be copied into the new OrderedMap.
191     * @param f the load factor.
192     */
193    public IntIntOrderedMap(final IntIntOrderedMap m, final float f) {
194        this(m.size(), f);
195        putAll(m);
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * Creates a new OrderedMap with 0.75f as load factor copying a given one.
200     *
201     * @param m a {@link Map} to be copied into the new OrderedMap.
202     */
203    public IntIntOrderedMap(final IntIntOrderedMap m) {
204        this(m, m.f);
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Creates a new OrderedMap using the elements of two parallel arrays.
209     *
210     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new OrderedMap.
211     * @param valueArray the array of corresponding values in the new OrderedMap.
212     * @param f the load factor.
213     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
214     */
215    public IntIntOrderedMap(final int[] keyArray, final int[] valueArray, final float f) {
216        this(keyArray.length, f);
217        if (keyArray.length != valueArray.length)
218            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The key array and the value array have different lengths (" + keyArray.length + " and " + valueArray.length + ")");
219        for (int i = 0; i < keyArray.length; i++)
220            put(keyArray[i], valueArray[i]);
221    }
222    /**
223     * Creates a new OrderedMap using the elements of two parallel arrays.
224     *
225     * @param keyColl the collection of keys of the new OrderedMap.
226     * @param valueColl the collection of corresponding values in the new OrderedMap.
227     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
228     */
229    public IntIntOrderedMap(final IntVLA keyColl, final IntVLA valueColl) {
230        this(keyColl, valueColl, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
231    }
232    /**
233     * Creates a new OrderedMap using the elements of two parallel arrays.
234     *
235     * @param keyColl the collection of keys of the new OrderedMap.
236     * @param valueColl the collection of corresponding values in the new OrderedMap.
237     * @param f the load factor.
238     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
239     */
240    public IntIntOrderedMap(final IntVLA keyColl, final IntVLA valueColl, final float f) {
241        this(keyColl.size, f);
242        if (keyColl.size != valueColl.size)
243            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The key array and the value array have different lengths (" + keyColl.size + " and " + valueColl.size + ")");
244        final int len = keyColl.size;
245        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
246            put(keyColl.get(i), valueColl.get(i));
247        }
248    }
249
250    /**
251     * Creates a new OrderedMap with 0.75f as load factor using the elements of two parallel arrays.
252     *
253     * @param keyArray the array of keys of the new OrderedMap.
254     * @param valueArray the array of corresponding values in the new OrderedMap.
255     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if <code>k</code> and <code>v</code> have different lengths.
256     */
257    public IntIntOrderedMap(final int[] keyArray, final int[] valueArray) {
258        this(keyArray, valueArray, DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR);
259    }
260    private int realSize() {
261        return containsNullKey ? size - 1 : size;
262    }
263    private void ensureCapacity(final int capacity) {
264        final int needed = arraySize(capacity, f);
265        if (needed > n)
266            rehash(needed);
267    }
268    private void tryCapacity(final long capacity) {
269        final int needed = (int) Math.min(
270                1 << 30,
271                Math.max(2, HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((long) Math.ceil(capacity
272                        / f))));
273        if (needed > n)
274            rehash(needed);
275    }
276    private int removeEntry(final int pos) {
277        final int oldValue = value[pos];
278        size--;
279        fixOrder(pos);
280        shiftKeys(pos);
281        if (size < (maxFill >> 2) && n > DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE)
282            rehash(n >> 1);
283        return oldValue;
284    }
285    private int removeNullEntry() {
286        containsNullKey = false;
287        final int oldValue = value[n];
288        size--;
289        fixOrder(n);
290        if (size < (maxFill >> 2) && n > DEFAULT_INITIAL_SIZE)
291            rehash(n >> 1);
292        return oldValue;
293    }
294
295    /**
296     * Puts the first key in keyArray with the first value in valueArray, then the second in each and so on.
297     * The entries are all appended to the end of the iteration order, unless a key was already present. Then,
298     * its value is changed at the existing position in the iteration order.
299     * If the lengths of the two arrays are not equal, this puts a number of entries equal to the lesser length.
300     * If either array is null, this returns without performing any changes.
301     * @param keyArray an array of int keys that should usually have the same length as valueArray
302     * @param valueArray an array of int values that should usually have the same length as keyArray
303     */
304    public void putAll(final int[] keyArray, final int[] valueArray)
305    {
306        if(keyArray == null || valueArray == null)
307            return;
308        for (int i = 0; i < keyArray.length && i < valueArray.length; i++)
309            put(keyArray[i], valueArray[i]);
310
311    }
312
313    /**
314     * Puts all key-value pairs in the Map m into this OrderedMap.
315     * The entries are all appended to the end of the iteration order, unless a key was already present. Then,
316     * its value is changed at the existing position in the iteration order. This can take any kind of Map,
317     * including unordered HashMap objects; if the Map does not have stable ordering, the order in which entries
318     * will be appended is not stable either. For this reason, OrderedMap, LinkedHashMap, and TreeMap (or other
319     * SortedMap implementations) will work best when order matters.
320     * @param m an IntIntOrderedMap to add into this
321     */
322    public void putAll(IntIntOrderedMap m) {
323        if (f <= .5)
324            ensureCapacity(m.size()); // The resulting map will be sized for m.size() elements
325        else
326            tryCapacity(size() + m.size()); // The resulting map will be size() +  m.size() elements
327        int n = m.size();
328        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {             
329            put(m.keyAt(i), m.getAt(i));
330        }
331    }
332    private int insert(final int k, final int v) {
333        int pos;
334        if (k == 0) {
335            if (containsNullKey)
336                return n;
337            containsNullKey = true;
338            pos = n;
339        } else {
340            int curr;
341            final int[] key = this.key;
342            // The starting point.
343            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) != 0) {
344                if (curr == k)
345                    return pos;
346                while ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) != 0)
347                    if (curr == k)
348                        return pos;
349            }
350        }
351        key[pos] = k;
352        value[pos] = v;
353        order.add(pos);
354        if (size++ >= maxFill)
355            rehash(arraySize(size + 1, f));
356        return -1;
357    }
358    private int insertAt(final int k, final int v, final int idx) {
359        int pos;
360        if (k == 0) {
361            if (containsNullKey)
362            {
363                fixOrder(n);
364                order.insert(idx, n);
365                return n;
366            }
367            containsNullKey = true;
368            pos = n;
369        } else {
370            int curr;
371            final int[] key = this.key;
372            // The starting point.
373            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) != 0) {
374                if (curr == k)
375                {
376                    fixOrder(pos);
377                    order.insert(idx, pos);
378                    return pos;
379                }
380                while ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) != 0)
381                    if (curr == k)
382                    {
383                        fixOrder(pos);
384                        order.insert(idx, pos);
385                        return pos;
386                    }
387            }
388        }
389        key[pos] = k;
390        value[pos] = v;
391        order.insert(idx, pos);
392        if (size++ >= maxFill)
393            rehash(arraySize(size + 1, f));
394        return -1;
395    }
396    public int put(final int k, final int v) {
397        final int pos = insert(k, v);
398        if (pos < 0)
399            return defRetValue;
400        final int oldValue = value[pos];
401        value[pos] = v;
402        return oldValue;
403    }
404    public int putAt(final int k, final int v, final int idx) {
405        final int pos = insertAt(k, v, idx);
406        if (pos < 0)
407            return defRetValue;
408        final int oldValue = value[pos];
409        value[pos] = v;
410        return oldValue;
411    }
412    /**
413     * Shifts left entries with the specified hash code, starting at the
414     * specified position, and empties the resulting free entry.
415     *
416     * @param pos
417     *            a starting position.
418     */
419    protected final void shiftKeys(int pos) {
420        // Shift entries with the same hash.
421        int last, slot;
422        int curr;
423        final int[] key = this.key;
424        for (;;) {
425            pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
426            for (;;) {
427                if ((curr = key[pos]) == 0) {
428                    key[last] = 0;
429                    return;
430                }
431                slot = (HashCommon.mix(curr))
432                        & mask;
433                if (last <= pos ? last >= slot || slot > pos : last >= slot
434                        && slot > pos)
435                    break;
436                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
437            }
438            key[last] = curr;
439            value[last] = value[pos];
440            fixOrder(pos, last);
441        }
442    }
443    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
444    public int remove(final int k) {
445        if (k == 0) {
446            if (containsNullKey)
447                return removeNullEntry();
448            return defRetValue;
449        }
450        int curr;
451        final int[] key = this.key;
452        int pos;
453        // The starting point.
454        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
455            return defRetValue;
456        if (k == curr)
457            return removeEntry(pos);
458        while (true) {
459            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
460                return defRetValue;
461            if (k == curr)
462                return removeEntry(pos);
463        }
464    }
465    private int setValue(final int pos, final int v) {
466        final int oldValue = value[pos];
467        value[pos] = v;
468        return oldValue;
469    }
470    /**
471     * Removes the mapping associated with the first key in iteration order.
472     *
473     * @return the value previously associated with the first key in iteration
474     *         order.
475     * @throws NoSuchElementException
476     *             is this map is empty.
477     */
478    public int removeFirst() {
479        return removeAt(0);
480    }
481    /**
482     * Removes the mapping associated with the last key in iteration order.
483     *
484     * @return the value previously associated with the last key in iteration
485     *         order.
486     * @throws NoSuchElementException
487     *             is this map is empty.
488     */
489    public int removeLast() {
490        return removeAt(size-1);
491    }
492    public int get(final int k) {
493        if (k == 0)
494            return containsNullKey ? value[n] : defRetValue;
495        int curr;
496        final int[] key = this.key;
497        int pos;
498        // The starting point.
499        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
500            return defRetValue;
501        if (k == curr)
502            return value[pos];
503        // There's always an unused entry.
504        while (true) {
505            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
506                return defRetValue;
507            if (k == curr)
508                return value[pos];
509        }
510    }
511
512
513    public int getOrDefault(final int k, final int defaultValue) {
514        if (k == 0)
515            return containsNullKey ? value[n] : defaultValue;
516        int curr;
517        final int[] key = this.key;
518        int pos;
519        // The starting point.
520        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
521            return defaultValue;
522        if (k == curr)
523            return value[pos];
524        // There's always an unused entry.
525        while (true) {
526            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
527                return defaultValue;
528            if (k == curr)
529                return value[pos];
530        }
531    }
532
533    protected int positionOf(final int k) {
534        if (k == 0)
535        {
536            if(containsNullKey)
537                return n;
538            else
539                return -1;
540        }
541        int curr;
542        final int[] key = this.key;
543        int pos;
544        // The starting point.
545        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
546            return -1;
547        if (k == curr)
548            return pos;
549        // There's always an unused entry.
550        while (true) {
551            if ((curr = key[pos = pos + 1 & mask]) == 0)
552                return -1;
553            if (k == curr)
554                return pos;
555        }
556    }
557
558    /**
559     * Gets the position in the ordering of the given key, though not as efficiently as some data structures can do it
560     * (e.g. {@link Arrangement} can access ordering position very quickly but doesn't store other values on its own).
561     * Returns a value that is at least 0 if it found k, or -1 if k was not present.
562     * @param k a key or possible key that this should find the index of
563     * @return the index of k, if present, or -1 if it is not present in this OrderedMap
564     */
565    public int indexOf(final int k)
566    {
567        int pos = positionOf(k);
568        return (pos < 0) ? -1 : order.indexOf(pos);
569    }
570
571    /**
572     * Swaps the positions in the ordering for the given items, if they are both present. Returns true if the ordering
573     * changed as a result of this call, or false if it stayed the same (which can be because left or right was not
574     * present, or because left and right are the same reference (so swapping would do nothing)).
575     * @param left an item that should be present in this OrderedMap
576     * @param right an item that should be present in this OrderedMap
577     * @return true if this OrderedMap changed in ordering as a result of this call, or false otherwise
578     */
579    public boolean swap(final int left, final int right)
580    {
581        if(left == right) return false;
582        int l = indexOf(left);
583        if(l < 0) return false;
584        int r = indexOf(right);
585        if(r < 0) return false;
586        order.swap(l, r);
587        return true;
588    }
589    /**
590     * Swaps the given indices in the ordering, if they are both valid int indices. Returns true if the ordering
591     * changed as a result of this call, or false if it stayed the same (which can be because left or right referred to
592     * an out-of-bounds index, or because left and right are equal (so swapping would do nothing)).
593     * @param left an index of an item in this OrderedMap, at least 0 and less than {@link #size()}
594     * @param right an index of an item in this OrderedMap, at least 0 and less than {@link #size()}
595     * @return true if this OrderedMap changed in ordering as a result of this call, or false otherwise
596     */
597    public boolean swapIndices(final int left, final int right)
598    {
599        if(left < 0 || right < 0 || left >= order.size || right >= order.size || left == right) return false;
600        order.swap(left, right);
601        return true;
602    }
603
604
605    public boolean containsKey(final int k) {
606        if (k == 0)
607            return containsNullKey;
608        int curr;
609        final int[] key = this.key;
610        int pos;
611        // The starting point.
612        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
613            return false;
614        if (k == curr)
615            return true;
616        // There's always an unused entry.
617        while (true) {
618            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
619                return false;
620            if (k == curr)
621                return true;
622        }
623    }
624    public boolean containsValue(final int v) {
625        final int[] value = this.value;
626        final int[] key = this.key;
627        if (containsNullKey && value[n] == v)
628            return true;
629        for (int i = n; i-- != 0;)
630            if (key[i] != 0 && value[i] == v)
631                return true;
632        return false;
633    }
634    /*
635     * Removes all elements from this map.
636     *
637     * <P>To increase object reuse, this method does not change the table size.
638     * If you want to reduce the table size, you must use {@link #trim()}.
639     */
640    public void clear() {
641        if (size == 0)
642            return;
643        size = 0;
644        containsNullKey = false;
645        Arrays.fill(key, 0);
646        order.clear();
647    }
648
649    public int size() {
650        return size;
651    }
652
653    public boolean isEmpty() {
654        return size == 0;
655    }
656
657    /**
658     * Looks up the key {@code k} in this map, remembers the associated value (which will be
659     * {@link #defaultReturnValue()} if k wasn't found), adds {@code increment} to the actual associated value in the
660     * map, and returns the remembered value.
661     * @param k a key to look up
662     * @param increment an int to add to the value associated with {@code k}
663     * @return the previous value associated with k, or {@link #defaultReturnValue()} if k wasn't found
664     */
665    public int getAndIncrement(int k, int increment) {
666        if (k == 0) {
667            if (containsNullKey) {
668                int got = value[n];
669                value[n] += increment;
670                return got;
671            } else {
672                value[n] = defRetValue + increment;
673                return defRetValue;
674            }
675        }
676        int curr;
677        final int[] key = this.key;
678        int pos;
679        // The starting point.
680        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
681        {
682            put(k, defRetValue + increment);
683            return defRetValue;
684        }
685        if (k == curr)
686        {
687            int got = value[pos];
688            value[pos] += increment;
689            return got;
690        }
691        // There's always an unused entry.
692        while (true) {
693            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
694            {
695                put(k, defRetValue + increment);
696                return defRetValue;
697            }
698            if (k == curr)
699            {
700                int got = value[pos];
701                value[pos] += increment;
702                return got;
703            }
704        }
705    }
706
707    /**
708     * The entry class for a OrderedMap does not record key and value, but rather the position in the hash table of the corresponding entry. This is necessary so that calls to
709     * {@link MapEntry#setValue(int)} are reflected in the map
710     */
711    public final class MapEntry {
712        // The table index this entry refers to, or -1 if this entry has been
713        // deleted.
714        int index;
715        MapEntry(final int index) {
716            this.index = index;
717        }
718        MapEntry() {
719        }
720        public int getKey() {
721            return key[index];
722        }
723        public int getValue() {
724            return value[index];
725        }
726        public int setValue(final int v) {
727            final int oldValue = value[index];
728            value[index] = v;
729            return oldValue;
730        }
731        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
732        public boolean equals(final Object o) {
733            if (!(o instanceof MapEntry))
734                return false;
735            MapEntry e = (MapEntry) o;
736            return (key[index] == e.getKey())
737                    && (value[index] == e.getValue());
738        }
739        public int hashCode() {
740            return HashCommon.mix(key[index])
741                    ^ HashCommon.mix(HashCommon.mix(value[index]));
742        }
743        @Override
744        public String toString() {
745            return key[index] + "=>" + value[index];
746        }
747    }
748
749    /**
750     * Modifies the ordering so that the given entry is removed. This method will complete in logarithmic time.
751     *
752     * @param i the index of an entry.
753     * @return the iteration-order index of the removed entry
754     */
755    protected int fixOrder(final int i) {
756        if (size == 0) {
757            order.clear();
758            return -1;
759        }
760        return order.removeValue(i);
761    }
762
763    /**
764     * Modifies the ordering for a shift from s to d.
765     * <br>
766     * This method will complete in logarithmic time or better.
767     *
768     * @param s the source position.
769     * @param d the destination position.
770     */
771    protected void fixOrder(int s, int d) {
772        if(size == 0)
773            return;
774        if (size == 1 || order.items[0] == s) {
775            order.set(0, d);
776        }
777        else if (order.items[order.size-1] == s) {
778            order.set(order.size - 1, d);
779        }
780        else
781        {
782            order.set(order.indexOf(s), d);
783        }
784    }
785
786    /**
787     * Returns the first key of this map in iteration order.
788     *
789     * @return the first key in iteration order.
790     */
791    public int firstKey() {
792        if (size == 0)
793            throw new NoSuchElementException();
794        return key[order.items[0]];
795    }
796    /**
797     * Returns the last key of this map in iteration order.
798     *
799     * @return the last key in iteration order.
800     */
801    public int lastKey() {
802        if (size == 0)
803            throw new NoSuchElementException();
804        return key[order.items[order.size-1]];
805    }
806    /**
807     * A list iterator over a OrderedMap.
808     *
809     * <P>
810     * This class provides a list iterator over a OrderedMap. The
811     * constructor runs in constant time.
812     */
813    private class MapIterator {
814        /**
815         * The entry that will be returned by the next call to
816         * {@link ListIterator#previous()} (or <code>null</code> if no
817         * previous entry exists).
818         */
819        int prev = -1;
820        /**
821         * The entry that will be returned by the next call to
822         * {@link ListIterator#next()} (or <code>null</code> if no
823         * next entry exists).
824         */
825        int next = -1;
826        /**
827         * The last entry that was returned (or -1 if we did not iterate or used
828         * {@link Iterator#remove()}).
829         */
830        int curr = -1;
831        /**
832         * The current index (in the sense of a {@link ListIterator}).
833         * Note that this value is not meaningful when this iterator has been
834         * created using the nonempty constructor.
835         */
836        int index = 0;
837        private MapIterator() {
838            next = size == 0 ? -1 : order.items[0];
839            index = 0;
840        }
841        /*
842        private MapIterator(final K from) {
843            if (((from) == null)) {
844                if (containsNullKey) {
845                    next = (int) link[n];
846                    prev = n;
847                    return;
848                } else
849                    throw new NoSuchElementException("The key null"
850                            + " does not belong to this map.");
851            }
852            if (((key[last]) != null && (key[last]).equals(from))) {
853                prev = last;
854                index = size;
855                return;
856            }
857            // The starting point.
858            int pos = (((from).hashCode()))
859                    & mask;
860            // There's always an unused entry.
861            while (!((key[pos]) == null)) {
862                if (((key[pos]).equals(from))) {
863                    // Note: no valid index known.
864                    next = (int) link[pos];
865                    prev = pos;
866                    return;
867                }
868                pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
869            }
870            throw new NoSuchElementException("The key " + from
871                    + " does not belong to this map.");
872        }*/
873        public boolean hasNext() {
874            return next != -1;
875        }
876        public boolean hasPrevious() {
877            return prev != -1;
878        }
879        private void ensureIndexKnown() {
880            if (index >= 0)
881                return;
882            if (prev == -1) {
883                index = 0;
884                return;
885            }
886            if (next == -1) {
887                index = size;
888                return;
889            }
890            index = 0;
891            /*while (pos != prev) {
892                pos = (int) link[pos];
893                index++;
894            }*/
895        }
896        public int nextIndex() {
897            ensureIndexKnown();
898            return index + 1;
899        }
900        public int previousIndex() {
901            ensureIndexKnown();
902            return index - 1;
903        }
904        public int nextEntry() {
905            if (!hasNext())
906                throw new NoSuchElementException();
907            curr = next;
908            if(++index >= order.size)
909                next = -1;
910            else
911                next = order.get(index);//(int) link[curr];
912            prev = curr;
913            return curr;
914        }
915        public int previousEntry() {
916            if (!hasPrevious())
917                throw new NoSuchElementException();
918            curr = prev;
919            if(--index < 1)
920                prev = -1;
921            else
922                prev = order.get(index - 1);
923            //prev = (int) (link[curr] >>> 32);
924            next = curr;
925            return curr;
926        }
927        public void remove() {
928            ensureIndexKnown();
929            if (curr == -1)
930                throw new IllegalStateException();
931            if (curr == prev) {
932                /*
933                 * If the last operation was a next(), we are removing an entry
934                 * that precedes the current index, and thus we must decrement
935                 * it.
936                 */
937                if(--index >= 1)
938                    prev = order.get(index - 1); //(int) (link[curr] >>> 32);
939                else
940                    prev = -1;
941            } else {
942                if(index < order.size - 1)
943                    next = order.get(index + 1);
944                else
945                    next = -1;
946            }
947            order.removeIndex(index);
948            size--;
949            int last, slot, pos = curr;
950            curr = -1;
951            if (pos == n) {
952                containsNullKey = false;
953            } else {
954                int curr;
955                final int[] key = IntIntOrderedMap.this.key;
956                // We have to horribly duplicate the shiftKeys() code because we
957                // need to update next/prev.
958                for (;;) {
959                    pos = ((last = pos) + 1) & mask;
960                    for (;;) {
961                        if ((curr = key[pos]) == 0) {
962                            key[last] = 0;
963                            return;
964                        }
965                        slot = (HashCommon.mix(curr)) & mask;
966                        if (last <= pos
967                                ? last >= slot || slot > pos
968                                : last >= slot && slot > pos)
969                            break;
970                        pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
971                    }
972                    key[last] = curr;
973                    value[last] = value[pos];
974                    if (next == pos)
975                        next = last;
976                    if (prev == pos)
977                        prev = last;
978                    fixOrder(pos, last);
979                }
980            }
981        }
982        public int skip(final int n) {
983            int i = n;
984            while (i-- != 0 && hasNext())
985                nextEntry();
986            return n - i - 1;
987        }
988        public int back(final int n) {
989            int i = n;
990            while (i-- != 0 && hasPrevious())
991                previousEntry();
992            return n - i - 1;
993        }
994    }
995    private class EntryIterator extends MapIterator
996            implements
997            Iterator<MapEntry>, Serializable {
998        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
999
1000        private MapEntry entry;
1001        public EntryIterator() {
1002        }
1003        public MapEntry next() {
1004            return entry = new MapEntry(nextEntry());
1005        }
1006        public MapEntry previous() {
1007            return entry = new MapEntry(previousEntry());
1008        }
1009        @Override
1010        public void remove() {
1011            super.remove();
1012            entry.index = -1; // You cannot use a deleted entry.
1013        }
1014    }
1015
1016    public class FastEntryIterator extends MapIterator implements ListIterator<MapEntry>, Serializable {
1017        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1018
1019        final MapEntry entry = new MapEntry();
1020
1021        public FastEntryIterator() {
1022        }
1023        public MapEntry next() {
1024            entry.index = nextEntry();
1025            return entry;
1026        }
1027        public MapEntry previous() {
1028            entry.index = previousEntry();
1029            return entry;
1030        }
1031        public void set(MapEntry ok) {
1032            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1033        }
1034        public void add(MapEntry ok) {
1035            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1036        }
1037    }
1038    public final class MapEntrySet
1039            implements Cloneable, SortedSet<MapEntry>, Set<MapEntry>, Serializable {
1040        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1041        public EntryIterator iterator() {
1042            return new EntryIterator();
1043        }
1044        public Comparator<? super MapEntry> comparator() {
1045            return null;
1046        }
1047        public SortedSet<MapEntry> subSet(
1048                MapEntry fromElement,
1049                MapEntry toElement) {
1050            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1051        }
1052        public SortedSet<MapEntry> headSet(
1053                MapEntry toElement) {
1054            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1055        }
1056        public SortedSet<MapEntry> tailSet(
1057                MapEntry fromElement) {
1058            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1059        }
1060        public MapEntry first() {
1061            if (size == 0)
1062                throw new NoSuchElementException();
1063            return new MapEntry(order.items[0]);
1064        }
1065        public MapEntry last() {
1066            if (size == 0)
1067                throw new NoSuchElementException();
1068            return new MapEntry(order.items[order.size-1]);
1069        }
1070        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1071        public boolean contains(final Object o) {
1072            if (!(o instanceof MapEntry))
1073                return false;
1074            final MapEntry e = (MapEntry) o;
1075            final int k = e.getKey();
1076            final int v = e.getValue();
1077            if (k == 0)
1078                return containsNullKey && (value[n] == v);
1079            int curr;
1080            final int[] key = IntIntOrderedMap.this.key;
1081            int pos;
1082            // The starting point.
1083            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
1084                return false;
1085            if (k == curr)
1086                return value[pos] == v;
1087            // There's always an unused entry.
1088            while (true) {
1089                if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
1090                    return false;
1091                if (k == curr)
1092                    return value[pos] == v;
1093            }
1094        }
1095        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1096        public boolean remove(final Object o) {
1097            if (!(o instanceof MapEntry))
1098                return false;
1099            final MapEntry e = (MapEntry) o;
1100            final int k = e.getKey();
1101            final int v = e.getValue();
1102            if (k == 0) {
1103                if (containsNullKey && value[n] == v) {
1104                    removeNullEntry();
1105                    return true;
1106                }
1107                return false;
1108            }
1109            int curr;
1110            final int[] key = IntIntOrderedMap.this.key;
1111            int pos;
1112            // The starting point.
1113            if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask]) == 0)
1114                return false;
1115            if (curr == k) {
1116                if (value[pos] == v) {
1117                    removeEntry(pos);
1118                    return true;
1119                }
1120                return false;
1121            }
1122            while (true) {
1123                if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
1124                    return false;
1125                if (curr == k) {
1126                    if (value[pos] == v) {
1127                        removeEntry(pos);
1128                        return true;
1129                    }
1130                }
1131            }
1132        }
1133        public int size() {
1134            return size;
1135        }
1136        public void clear() {
1137            IntIntOrderedMap.this.clear();
1138        }
1139
1140        public FastEntryIterator fastIterator() {
1141            return new FastEntryIterator();
1142        }
1143
1144        @Override
1145        public boolean equals(final Object o) {
1146            if (o == this)
1147                return true;
1148            if (!(o instanceof Set))
1149                return false;
1150            Set<?> s = (Set<?>) o;
1151            return s.size() == size() && containsAll(s);
1152        }
1153
1154        public Object[] toArray() {
1155            final Object[] a = new Object[size()];
1156            objectUnwrap(iterator(), a);
1157            return a;
1158        }
1159
1160        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1161        public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
1162            if (a == null || a.length < size()) a = (T[]) new Object[size()];
1163            objectUnwrap(iterator(), a);
1164            return a;
1165        }
1166
1167        /**
1168         * Unsupported.
1169         *
1170         * @param c ignored
1171         * @return nothing, throws UnsupportedOperationException
1172         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException always
1173         */
1174        public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends MapEntry> c) {
1175            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("addAll not supported");
1176        }
1177
1178        /**
1179         * Unsupported.
1180         *
1181         * @param k ignored
1182         * @return nothing, throws UnsupportedOperationException
1183         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException always
1184         */
1185        public boolean add(MapEntry k) {
1186            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("add not supported");
1187        }
1188
1189        /**
1190         * Checks whether this collection contains all elements from the given
1191         * collection.
1192         *
1193         * @param c a collection.
1194         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection contains all elements of the
1195         * argument.
1196         */
1197        public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {
1198            int n = c.size();
1199            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1200            while (n-- != 0)
1201                if (!contains(i.next()))
1202                    return false;
1203            return true;
1204        }
1205
1206        /**
1207         * Retains in this collection only elements from the given collection.
1208         *
1209         * @param c a collection.
1210         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the
1211         * call.
1212         */
1213        public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
1214            boolean retVal = false;
1215            int n = size();
1216            final Iterator<?> i = iterator();
1217            while (n-- != 0) {
1218                if (!c.contains(i.next())) {
1219                    i.remove();
1220                    retVal = true;
1221                }
1222            }
1223            return retVal;
1224        }
1225
1226        /**
1227         * Remove from this collection all elements in the given collection. If the
1228         * collection is an instance of this class, it uses faster iterators.
1229         *
1230         * @param c a collection.
1231         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the
1232         * call.
1233         */
1234        public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
1235            boolean retVal = false;
1236            int n = c.size();
1237            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1238            while (n-- != 0)
1239                if (remove(i.next()))
1240                    retVal = true;
1241            return retVal;
1242        }
1243
1244        public boolean isEmpty() {
1245            return size() == 0;
1246        }
1247
1248        @Override
1249        public String toString() {
1250            final StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
1251            final EntryIterator i = iterator();
1252            int n = size();
1253            MapEntry k;
1254            boolean first = true;
1255            s.append("{");
1256            while (n-- != 0) {
1257                if (first)
1258                    first = false;
1259                else
1260                    s.append(", ");
1261                k = i.next();                 
1262                s.append(key[k.index]).append("=>").append(value[k.index]);
1263            }
1264            s.append("}");
1265            return s.toString();
1266        }
1267
1268    }
1269
1270    public SortedSet<MapEntry> entrySet() {
1271        if (entries == null) entries = new MapEntrySet();
1272        return entries;
1273    }
