1275    /**
1276     * An iterator on keys.
1277     * <p>
1278     * <P>We simply override the {@link ListIterator#next()}/{@link ListIterator#previous()} methods (and possibly their type-specific counterparts) so that they return keys
1279     * instead of entries.
1280     */
1281    public final class KeyIterator extends MapIterator implements Iterator<Integer>, Serializable {
1282        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1283        public Integer previous() {
1284            return key[previousEntry()];
1285        }        
1286        public int previousInt() {
1287            return key[previousEntry()];
1288        }
1289        public void set(Integer k) {
1290            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1291        }
1292        public void add(Integer k) {
1293            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1294        }
1295        public KeyIterator() {}
1296        public Integer next() {
1297            return key[nextEntry()];
1298        }
1299        public int nextInt() {
1300            return key[nextEntry()];
1301        }
1302        public void remove() { super.remove(); }
1303    }
1304
1305    public final class KeySet implements SortedSet<Integer>, Serializable {
1306        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1307
1308        public KeyIterator iterator() {
1309            return new KeyIterator();
1310        }
1311
1312        public int size() {
1313            return size;
1314        }
1315
1316        public void clear() {
1317            IntIntOrderedMap.this.clear();
1318        }
1319
1320        public Integer first() {
1321            if (size == 0) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1322            return key[order.items[0]];
1323        }
1324
1325        public Integer last() {
1326            if (size == 0) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1327            return key[order.items[order.size-1]];
1328        }
1329
1330        public Comparator<Integer> comparator() {
1331            return null;
1332        }
1333
1334        public final SortedSet<Integer> tailSet(Integer from) {
1335            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1336        }
1337
1338        public final SortedSet<Integer> headSet(Integer to) {
1339            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1340        }
1341
1342        public final SortedSet<Integer> subSet(Integer from, Integer to) {
1343            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1344        }
1345
1346        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1347        @Override
1348        public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
1349            if (a == null || a.length < size()) a = (T[]) new Object[size()];
1350            unwrap(iterator(), a);
1351            return a;
1352        }
1353
1354        /**
1355         * Always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1356         */
1357        public boolean remove(Object ok) {
1358            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot remove from the key set directly");
1359        }
1360
1361        /**
1362         * Always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1363         */
1364        public boolean add(final Integer o) {
1365            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot add to the key set directly");
1366        }
1367
1368        /**
1369         * Delegates to the corresponding type-specific method.
1370         */
1371        public boolean contains(final Object o) {
1372            return o instanceof Integer && containsKey((Integer) o);
1373        }
1374
1375        /**
1376         * Checks whether this collection contains all elements from the given type-specific collection.
1377         *
1378         * @param c a type-specific collection.
1379         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection contains all elements of the argument.
1380         */
1381        public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {
1382            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1383            int n = c.size();
1384            while (n-- != 0)
1385                if (!contains(i.next())) return false;
1386            return true;
1387        }
1388
1389        /**
1390         * Retains in this collection only elements from the given type-specific collection.
1391         *
1392         * @param c a type-specific collection.
1393         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the call.
1394         */
1395        public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
1396            boolean retVal = false;
1397            int n = size();
1398            final Iterator<?> i = iterator();
1399            while (n-- != 0) {
1400                if (!c.contains(i.next())) {
1401                    i.remove();
1402                    retVal = true;
1403                }
1404            }
1405            return retVal;
1406        }
1407
1408        /**
1409         * Remove from this collection all elements in the given type-specific collection.
1410         *
1411         * @param c a type-specific collection.
1412         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the call.
1413         */
1414        public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
1415            boolean retVal = false;
1416            int n = c.size();
1417            final Iterator<?> i = c.iterator();
1418            while (n-- != 0)
1419                if (remove(i.next())) retVal = true;
1420            return retVal;
1421        }
1422
1423        public Object[] toArray() {
1424            final Object[] a = new Object[size()];
1425            objectUnwrap(iterator(), a);
1426            return a;
1427        }
1428
1429        /**
1430         * Adds all elements of the given collection to this collection.
1431         *
1432         * @param c a collection.
1433         * @return <code>true</code> if this collection changed as a result of the call.
1434         */
1435        public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends Integer> c) {
1436            boolean retVal = false;
1437            final Iterator<? extends Integer> i = c.iterator();
1438            int n = c.size();
1439            while (n-- != 0)
1440                if (add(i.next())) retVal = true;
1441            return retVal;
1442        }
1443
1444        @Override
1445        public boolean equals(final Object o) {
1446            if (o == this)
1447                return true;
1448            if (!(o instanceof Set))
1449                return false;
1450            Set<?> s = (Set<?>) o;
1451            if (s.size() != size())
1452                return false;
1453            return containsAll(s);
1454        }
1455        /**
1456         * Unwraps an iterator into an array starting at a given offset for a given number of elements.
1457         * <p>
1458         * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned, up to a maximum of <code>length</code>, in the given array starting at <code>offset</code>. The
1459         * number of actually unwrapped elements is returned (it may be less than <code>max</code> if the iterator emits less than <code>max</code> elements).
1460         *
1461         * @param i      a type-specific iterator.
1462         * @param array  an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1463         * @param offset the first element of the array to be returned.
1464         * @param max    the maximum number of elements to unwrap.
1465         * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1466         */
1467        public int unwrap(final KeyIterator i, final int[] array, int offset, final int max) {
1468            if (max < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The maximum number of elements (" + max + ") is negative");
1469            if (offset < 0 || offset + max > array.length) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1470            int j = max;
1471            while (j-- != 0 && i.hasNext())
1472                array[offset++] = i.nextInt();
1473            return max - j - 1;
1474        }
1475        /**
1476         * Unwraps an iterator into an array.
1477         * <p>
1478         * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned in the given array. The iteration will stop when the iterator has no more elements or when the end
1479         * of the array has been reached.
1480         *
1481         * @param i     a type-specific iterator.
1482         * @param array an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1483         * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1484         */
1485        public int unwrap(final KeyIterator i, final int[] array) {
1486            return unwrap(i, array, 0, array.length);
1487        }
1488        public int[] toIntArray() {
1489            int[] a = new int[size()];
1490            unwrap(iterator(), a);
1491            return a;
1492        }
1493
1494        public int[] toIntArray(int[] a) {
1495            if (a == null || a.length < size()) a = new int[size()];
1496            unwrap(iterator(), a);
1497            return a;
1498        }
1499
1500        /**
1501         * Unwraps an iterator into an array starting at a given offset for a given number of elements.
1502         * <p>
1503         * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned, up to a maximum of <code>length</code>, in the given array starting at <code>offset</code>. The
1504         * number of actually unwrapped elements is returned (it may be less than <code>max</code> if the iterator emits less than <code>max</code> elements).
1505         *
1506         * @param i      a type-specific iterator.
1507         * @param array  an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1508         * @param offset the first element of the array to be returned.
1509         * @param max    the maximum number of elements to unwrap.
1510         * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1511         */
1512        public int unwrap(final KeyIterator i, final Object[] array, int offset, final int max) {
1513            if (max < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The maximum number of elements (" + max + ") is negative");
1514            if (offset < 0 || offset + max > array.length) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1515            int j = max;
1516            while (j-- != 0 && i.hasNext())
1517                array[offset++] = i.next();
1518            return max - j - 1;
1519        }
1520
1521        /**
1522         * Unwraps an iterator into an array.
1523         * <p>
1524         * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned in the given array. The iteration will stop when the iterator has no more elements or when the end
1525         * of the array has been reached.
1526         *
1527         * @param i     a type-specific iterator.
1528         * @param array an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1529         * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1530         */
1531        public int unwrap(final KeyIterator i, final Object[] array) {
1532            return unwrap(i, array, 0, array.length);
1533        }
1534
1535        public boolean isEmpty() {
1536            return size() == 0;
1537        }
1538
1539        @Override
1540        public String toString() {
1541            final StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
1542            final KeyIterator i = iterator();
1543            int n = size();
1544            boolean first = true;
1545            s.append("{");
1546            while (n-- != 0) {
1547                if (first) first = false;
1548                else s.append(", ");
1549                s.append(i.next());
1550            }
1551            s.append("}");
1552            return s.toString();
1553        }
1554    }
1555
1556    public KeySet keySet() {
1557        if (keys == null) keys = new KeySet();
1558        return keys;
1559    }
1560
1561    public OrderedSet<Integer> keysAsOrderedSet()
1562    {
1563        OrderedSet<Integer> os = new OrderedSet<>(size, f);
1564        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1565            os.add(keyAt(i));
1566        }
1567        return os;
1568    }
1569    public int[] keysAsArray() {
1570        return keySet().toIntArray();
1571    }
1572
1573    /**
1574     * An iterator on values.
1575     * <p>
1576     * <P>We simply override the {@link ListIterator#next()}/{@link ListIterator#previous()} methods (and possibly their type-specific counterparts) so that they return values
1577     * instead of entries.
1578     */
1579    public final class ValueIterator extends MapIterator implements ListIterator<Integer>, Serializable {
1580        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1581
1582        public Integer previous() {
1583            return value[previousEntry()];
1584        }
1585        public void set(Integer v) {
1586            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1587        }
1588        public void add(Integer v) {
1589            throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1590        }
1591        public ValueIterator() {}
1592        public Integer next() {
1593            return value[nextEntry()];
1594        }
1595        public void remove() { super.remove(); }
1596    }
1597    public final class ValueCollection extends AbstractCollection<Integer> implements Serializable
1598    {
1599        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
1600        public ValueIterator iterator() {
1601            return new ValueIterator();
1602        }
1603        public int size() {
1604            return size;
1605        }
1606        public boolean contains(Object v) {
1607            return v instanceof Integer && containsValue((Integer)v);
1608        }
1609        public void clear() {
1610            IntIntOrderedMap.this.clear();
1611        }
1612    }
1613    public Collection<Integer> values() {
1614        if (values == null) values = new ValueCollection();
1615        return values;
1616    }
1617
1618    public IntVLA valuesAsList()
1619    {
1620        IntVLA ls = new IntVLA(size);
1621        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1622            ls.add(getAt(i));
1623        }
1624        return ls;
1625    }
1626
1627    /**
1628     * Rehashes the map, making the table as small as possible.
1629     * <p>
1630     * <P>This method rehashes the table to the smallest size satisfying the load factor. It can be used when the set will not be changed anymore, so to optimize access speed and size.
1631     * <p>
1632     * <P>If the table size is already the minimum possible, this method does nothing.
1633     *
1634     * @return true if there was enough memory to trim the map.
1635     * @see #trim(int)
1636     */
1637    public boolean trim() {
1638        final int l = arraySize(size, f);
1639        if (l >= n || size > maxFill(l, f)) return true;
1640        try {
1641            rehash(l);
1642        } catch (Exception cantDoIt) {
1643            return false;
1644        }
1645        return true;
1646    }
1647
1648    /**
1649     * Rehashes this map if the table is too large.
1650     * <p>
1651     * <P>Let <var>N</var> be the smallest table size that can hold <code>max(n,{@link #size()})</code> entries, still satisfying the load factor. If the current table size is smaller than or equal to
1652     * <var>N</var>, this method does nothing. Otherwise, it rehashes this map in a table of size <var>N</var>.
1653     * <p>
1654     * <P>This method is useful when reusing maps. {@linkplain #clear() Clearing a map} leaves the table size untouched. If you are reusing a map many times, you can call this method with a typical
1655     * size to avoid keeping around a very large table just because of a few large transient maps.
1656     *
1657     * @param n the threshold for the trimming.
1658     * @return true if there was enough memory to trim the map.
1659     * @see #trim()
1660     */
1661    public boolean trim(final int n) {
1662        final int l = HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((int) Math.ceil(n / f));
1663        if (l >= n || size > maxFill(l, f)) return true;
1664        try {
1665            rehash(l);
1666        } catch (Exception cantDoIt) {
1667            return false;
1668        }
1669        return true;
1670    }
1671
1672    /**
1673     * Rehashes the map.
1674     *
1675     * <P>
1676     * This method implements the basic rehashing strategy, and may be overriden
1677     * by subclasses implementing different rehashing strategies (e.g.,
1678     * disk-based rehashing). However, you should not override this method
1679     * unless you understand the internal workings of this class.
1680     *
1681     * @param newN
1682     *            the new size
1683     */
1684
1685    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1686    protected void rehash(final int newN) {
1687        final int[] key = this.key;
1688        final int[] value = this.value;
1689        final int mask = newN - 1; // Note that this is used by the hashing macro
1690        final int[] newKey = new int[newN + 1];
1691        final int[] newValue = new int[newN + 1];
1692        final int sz = order.size;
1693        int k;
1694        int i, pos;
1695        final int[] oi = order.items;
1696        for (int q = 0; q < sz; q++) {
1697            i = oi[q];
1698            if ((k = key[i]) == 0)
1699                pos = newN;
1700            else {
1701                pos = (HashCommon.mix(k)) & mask;
1702                while (newKey[pos] != 0)
1703                    pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
1704            }
1705            newKey[pos] = k;
1706            newValue[pos] = value[i];
1707            oi[q] = pos;
1708        }
1709        n = newN;
1710        this.mask = mask;
1711        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
1712        this.key = newKey;
1713        this.value = newValue;
1714    }
1715    /*
1716    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1717    protected void rehash(final int newN) {
1718        final K key[] = this.key;
1719        final V value[] = this.value;
1720        final int mask = newN - 1; // Note that this is used by the hashing
1721        // macro
1722        final K newKey[] = (K[]) new Object[newN + 1];
1723        final V newValue[] = (V[]) new Object[newN + 1];
1724        int i = first, prev = -1, newPrev = -1, t, pos;
1725        final long link[] = this.link;
1726        final long newLink[] = new long[newN + 1];
1727        first = -1;
1728        for (int j = size; j-- != 0;) {
1729            if (((key[i]) == null))
1730                pos = newN;
1731            else {
1732                pos = (((key[i]).hashCode())) & mask;
1733                while (!((newKey[pos]) == null))
1734                    pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
1735            }
1736            newKey[pos] = key[i];
1737            newValue[pos] = value[i];
1738            if (prev != -1) {
1739                newLink[newPrev] ^= ((newLink[newPrev] ^ (pos & 0xFFFFFFFFL)) & 0xFFFFFFFFL);
1740                newLink[pos] ^= ((newLink[pos] ^ ((newPrev & 0xFFFFFFFFL) << 32)) & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000L);
1741                newPrev = pos;
1742            } else {
1743                newPrev = first = pos;
1744                // Special case of SET(newLink[ pos ], -1, -1);
1745                newLink[pos] = -1L;
1746            }
1747            t = i;
1748            i = (int) link[i];
1749            prev = t;
1750        }
1751        this.link = newLink;
1752        this.last = newPrev;
1753        if (newPrev != -1)
1754            // Special case of SET_NEXT( newLink[ newPrev ], -1 );
1755            newLink[newPrev] |= -1 & 0xFFFFFFFFL;
1756        n = newN;
1757        this.mask = mask;
1758        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
1759        this.key = newKey;
1760        this.value = newValue;
1761    }
1762    */
1763    /**
1764     * Returns a deep copy of this map.
1765     *
1766     * <P>
1767     * This method performs a deep copy of this OrderedMap; the data stored in the
1768     * map, however, is not cloned. Note that this makes a difference only for
1769     * object keys.
1770     *
1771     * @return a deep copy of this map.
1772     */
1773    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1774    @GwtIncompatible
1775    public IntIntOrderedMap clone() {
1776        IntIntOrderedMap c;
1777        try {
1778            c = (IntIntOrderedMap) super.clone();
1779            c.key = new int[n + 1];
1780            System.arraycopy(key, 0, c.key, 0, n + 1);
1781            c.value = new int[n + 1];
1782            System.arraycopy(value, 0, c.value, 0, n + 1);
1783            c.order = (IntVLA) order.clone();
1784            return c;
1785        } catch (Exception cantHappen) {
1786            throw new UnsupportedOperationException(cantHappen + (cantHappen.getMessage() != null ?
1787                    "; " + cantHappen.getMessage() : ""));
1788        }
1789    }
1790    /**
1791     * Returns a hash code for this map.
1792     *
1793     * @return a hash code for this map.
1794     */
1795    public int hashCode() {
1796        int h = 0;
1797        for (int j = realSize(), i = 0, t = 0; j-- != 0;) {
1798            while (key[i] == 0)
1799                i++;             
1800            t = HashCommon.mix(key[i]) ^ HashCommon.mix(value[i] ^ HashCommon.INV_INT_PHI);
1801            h += t;
1802            i++;
1803        }
1804        // Zero / null keys have hash zero.
1805        if (containsNullKey)
1806            h += HashCommon.mix(value[n] ^ HashCommon.INV_INT_PHI);
1807        return h;
1808    }
1809
1810    public long hash64()
1811    {
1812        return 31L * (31L * CrossHash.hash64(key) + CrossHash.hash64(value)) + size;
1813    }
1814    /**
1815     * Returns the maximum number of entries that can be filled before rehashing.
1816     *
1817     * @param n the size of the backing array.
1818     * @param f the load factor.
1819     * @return the maximum number of entries before rehashing.
1820     */
1821    public static int maxFill(final int n, final float f) {
1822        /* We must guarantee that there is always at least
1823         * one free entry (even with pathological load factors). */
1824        return Math.min((int)(n * f + 0.99999994f), n - 1);
1825    }
1826
1827    /**
1828     * Returns the least power of two smaller than or equal to 2<sup>30</sup> and larger than or equal to <code>Math.ceil( expected / f )</code>.
1829     *
1830     * @param expected the expected number of elements in a hash table.
1831     * @param f        the load factor.
1832     * @return the minimum possible size for a backing array.
1833     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the necessary size is larger than 2<sup>30</sup>.
1834     */
1835    public static int arraySize(final int expected, final float f) {
1836        final long s = Math.max(2, HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((long) Math.ceil(expected / f)));
1837        if (s > (1 << 30))
1838            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Too large (" + expected + " expected elements with load factor " + f + ")");
1839        return (int) s;
1840    }
1841
1842    /**
1843     * Unwraps an iterator into an array starting at a given offset for a given number of elements.
1844     * <p>
1845     * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned, up to a maximum of <code>length</code>, in the given array starting at <code>offset</code>. The
1846     * number of actually unwrapped elements is returned (it may be less than <code>max</code> if the iterator emits less than <code>max</code> elements).
1847     *
1848     * @param i      a type-specific iterator.
1849     * @param array  an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1850     * @param offset the first element of the array to be returned.
1851     * @param max    the maximum number of elements to unwrap.
1852     * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1853     */
1854    private int unwrap(final ValueIterator i, final Object[] array, int offset, final int max) {
1855        if (max < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("The maximum number of elements (" + max + ") is negative");
1856        if (offset < 0 || offset + max > array.length) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1857        int j = max;
1858        while (j-- != 0 && i.hasNext())
1859            array[offset++] = i.next();
1860        return max - j - 1;
1861    }
1862
1863    /**
1864     * Unwraps an iterator into an array.
1865     * <p>
1866     * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned in the given array. The iteration will stop when the iterator has no more elements or when the end
1867     * of the array has been reached.
1868     *
1869     * @param i     a type-specific iterator.
1870     * @param array an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1871     * @return the number of elements unwrapped.
1872     */
1873    private int unwrap(final ValueIterator i, final Object[] array) {
1874        return unwrap(i, array, 0, array.length);
1875    }
1876
1877
1878    /** Unwraps an iterator into an array starting at a given offset for a given number of elements.
1879     *
1880     * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned, up to a maximum of <code>length</code>, in the given array starting at <code>offset</code>. The
1881     * number of actually unwrapped elements is returned (it may be less than <code>max</code> if the iterator emits less than <code>max</code> elements).
1882     *
1883     * @param i a type-specific iterator.
1884     * @param array an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1885     * @param offset the first element of the array to be returned.
1886     * @param max the maximum number of elements to unwrap.
1887     * @return the number of elements unwrapped. */
1888    private static <K> int objectUnwrap(final Iterator<? extends K> i, final K[] array, int offset, final int max ) {
1889        if ( max < 0 ) throw new IllegalArgumentException( "The maximum number of elements (" + max + ") is negative" );
1890        if ( offset < 0 || offset + max > array.length ) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1891        int j = max;
1892        while ( j-- != 0 && i.hasNext() )
1893            array[ offset++ ] = i.next();
1894        return max - j - 1;
1895    }
1896
1897    /** Unwraps an iterator into an array.
1898     *
1899     * <P>This method iterates over the given type-specific iterator and stores the elements returned in the given array. The iteration will stop when the iterator has no more elements or when the end
1900     * of the array has been reached.
1901     *
1902     * @param i a type-specific iterator.
1903     * @param array an array to contain the output of the iterator.
1904     * @return the number of elements unwrapped. */
1905    private static <K> int objectUnwrap(final Iterator<? extends K> i, final K[] array) {
1906        return objectUnwrap(i, array, 0, array.length );
1907    }
1908
1909    @Override
1910    public String toString() {
1911        final StringBuilder s = new StringBuilder();
1912        int n = size(), i = 0;
1913        boolean first = true;
1914        s.append("IntIntOrderedMap{");
1915        while (i < n) {
1916            if (first) first = false;
1917            else s.append(", ");
1918            s.append(entryAt(i++));
1919        }
1920        s.append("}");
1921        return s.toString();
1922    }
1923    @Override
1924    public boolean equals(Object o) {
1925        if (o == this)
1926            return true;
1927        if (!(o instanceof IntIntOrderedMap))
1928            return false;
1929        IntIntOrderedMap m = (IntIntOrderedMap) o;
1930        if (m.size() != size())
1931            return false;
1932        return entrySet().containsAll(m.entrySet());
1933    }
1934
1935    @GwtIncompatible
1936    private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream s)
1937            throws java.io.IOException {
1938        final int[] key = this.key;
1939        final int[] value = this.value;
1940        final MapIterator i = new MapIterator();
1941        s.defaultWriteObject();
1942        for (int j = size, e; j-- != 0;) {
1943            e = i.nextEntry();
1944            s.writeInt(key[e]);
1945            s.writeInt(value[e]);
1946        }
1947    }
1948    @GwtIncompatible
1949    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1950    private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream s)
1951            throws java.io.IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1952        s.defaultReadObject();
1953        n = arraySize(size, f);
1954        maxFill = maxFill(n, f);
1955        mask = n - 1;
1956        final int[] key = this.key = new int[n + 1];
1957        final int[] value = this.value = new int[n + 1];
1958        final IntVLA order = this.order = new IntVLA(n + 1);
1959        int k;
1960        int v;
1961        for (int i = size, pos; i-- != 0;) {
1962            k = s.readInt();
1963            v = s.readInt();
1964            if (k == 0) {
1965                pos = n;
1966                containsNullKey = true;
1967            } else {
1968                pos = (HashCommon.mix(k))
1969                        & mask;
1970                while (!(key[pos] == 0))
1971                    pos = (pos + 1) & mask;
1972            }
1973
1974            key[pos] = k;
1975            value[pos] = v;
1976            order.add(pos);
1977        }
1978    }
1979
1980    /**
1981     * Gets the value at the given index in the iteration order in constant time (random-access).
1982     * @param idx the index in the iteration order of the value to fetch
1983     * @return the value at the index, if the index is valid, otherwise the default return value
1984     */
1985    public int getAt(final int idx) {
1986        int pos;
1987        if (idx < 0 || idx >= order.size)
1988            return defRetValue;
1989        // The starting point.
1990        if (key[pos = order.get(idx)] == 0)
1991            return containsNullKey ? value[n] : defRetValue;
1992        return value[pos];
1993    }
1994    /**
1995     * Gets the key at the given index in the iteration order in constant time (random-access).
1996     * @param idx the index in the iteration order of the key to fetch
1997     * @return the key at the index, if the index is valid, otherwise 0
1998     */
1999    public int keyAt(final int idx) {
2000        if (idx < 0 || idx >= order.size)
2001            return 0;
2002        // The starting point.
2003        return key[order.get(idx)];
2004    }
2005
2006    /**
2007     * Gets the key-value Map.Entry at the given index in the iteration order in constant time (random-access).
2008     * @param idx the index in the iteration order of the entry to fetch
2009     * @return the key-value entry at the index, if the index is valid, otherwise null
2010     */
2011    public MapEntry entryAt(final int idx)
2012    {
2013        if (idx < 0 || idx >= order.size)
2014            return null;
2015        return new MapEntry(order.get(idx));
2016    }
2017
2018    /**
2019     * Removes the key and value at the given index in the iteration order in not-exactly constant time (though it still
2020     * should be efficient).
2021     * @param idx the index in the iteration order of the key and value to remove
2022     * @return the value removed, if there was anything removed, or the default return value otherwise (often null)
2023     */
2024    public int removeAt(final int idx) {
2025
2026        if (idx < 0 || idx >= order.size)
2027            return defRetValue;
2028        int pos = order.get(idx);
2029        if (key[pos] == 0) {
2030            if (containsNullKey)
2031                return removeNullEntry();
2032            return defRetValue;
2033        }
2034        return removeEntry(pos);
2035    }
2036    /**
2037     * Gets a random value from this OrderedMap in constant time, using the given IRNG to generate a random number.
2038     * @param rng used to generate a random index for a value
2039     * @return a random value from this OrderedMap
2040     */
2041    public int randomValue(IRNG rng)
2042    {
2043        return getAt(rng.nextInt(order.size));
2044    }
2045
2046    /**
2047     * Gets a random key from this OrderedMap in constant time, using the given IRNG to generate a random number.
2048     * @param rng used to generate a random index for a key
2049     * @return a random key from this OrderedMap
2050     */
2051    public int randomKey(IRNG rng)
2052    {
2053        return keyAt(rng.nextInt(order.size));
2054    }
2055
2056    /**
2057     * Gets a random entry from this OrderedMap in constant time, using the given IRNG to generate a random number.
2058     * @param rng used to generate a random index for a entry
2059     * @return a random key-value entry from this OrderedMap
2060     */
2061    public MapEntry randomEntry(IRNG rng)
2062    {
2063        return new MapEntry(order.getRandomElement(rng));
2064    }
2065
2066    /**
2067     * Randomly alters the iteration order for this OrderedMap using the given IRNG to shuffle.
2068     * @param rng used to generate a random ordering
2069     * @return this for chaining
2070     */
2071    public IntIntOrderedMap shuffle(IRNG rng)
2072    {
2073        if(size < 2)
2074            return this;
2075        order.shuffle(rng);
2076        return this;
2077    }
2078
2079    /**
2080     * Given an array or varargs of replacement indices for this OrderedMap's iteration order, reorders this so the
2081     * first item in the returned version is the same as {@code getAt(ordering[0])} (with some care taken for negative
2082     * or too-large indices), the second item in the returned version is the same as {@code getAt(ordering[1])}, etc.
2083     * <br>
2084     * Negative indices are considered reversed distances from the end of ordering, so -1 refers to the same index as
2085     * {@code ordering[ordering.length - 1]}. If ordering is smaller than {@code size()}, only the indices up to the
2086     * length of ordering will be modified. If ordering is larger than {@code size()}, only as many indices will be
2087     * affected as {@code size()}, and reversed distances are measured from the end of this Map's entries instead of
2088     * the end of ordering. Duplicate values in ordering will produce duplicate values in the returned Map.
2089     * <br>
2090     * This method modifies this OrderedMap in-place and also returns it for chaining.
2091     * @param ordering an array or varargs of int indices, where the nth item in ordering changes the nth item in this
2092     *                 Map to have the value currently in this Map at the index specified by the value in ordering
2093     * @return this for chaining, after modifying it in-place
2094     */
2095    public IntIntOrderedMap reorder(int... ordering)
2096    {
2097        order.reorder(ordering);
2098        return this;
2099    }
2100    private int alterEntry(final int pos) {
2101        int idx = fixOrder(pos);
2102        size--;
2103        shiftKeys(pos);
2104        return idx;
2105    }
2106    private int alterNullEntry() {
2107        int idx = fixOrder(n);
2108        containsNullKey = false;
2109        size--;
2110        return idx;
2111    }
2112    /**
2113     * Swaps a key, original, for another key, replacement, while keeping replacement at the same point in the iteration
2114     * order as original and keeping it associated with the same value (which also keeps its iteration index). Unlike
2115     * the similar method {@link #alter(int, int)}, this will not change this OrderedMap if replacement is already
2116     * present. To contrast, alter() can reduce the size of the OrderedMap if both original and replacement are already
2117     * in the Map. If replacement is found, this returns the default return value, otherwise it switches out original
2118     * for replacement and returns whatever was associated with original.
2119     * @param original the key to find and swap out
2120     * @param replacement the key to replace original with
2121     * @return the value associated with original before, and replacement now
2122     */
2123    public int alterCarefully(final int original, final int replacement) {
2124        if(!containsKey(replacement))
2125            return alter(original, replacement);
2126        else
2127            return defRetValue;
2128    }
2129    /**
2130     * Swaps a key, original, for another key, replacement, while keeping replacement at the same point in the iteration
2131     * order as original and keeping it associated with the same value (which also keeps its iteration index).
2132     * Be aware that if both original and replacement are present in the OrderedMap, this will still replace original
2133     * with replacement but will also remove the other occurrence of replacement to avoid duplicate keys. This can throw
2134     * off the expected order because the duplicate could be at any point in the ordering when it is removed. You may
2135     * want to prefer {@link #alterCarefully(int, int)} if you don't feel like checking by hand for whether
2136     * replacement is already present, but using this method is perfectly reasonable if you know overlaps won't happen.
2137     * @param original the key to find and swap out
2138     * @param replacement the key to replace original with
2139     * @return the value associated with original before, and replacement now
2140     */
2141    public int alter(final int original, final int replacement) {
2142        int v;
2143        int idx;
2144        if (original == 0) {
2145            if (containsNullKey) {
2146                v = value[n];
2147                idx = alterNullEntry();
2148                putAt(replacement, v, idx);
2149                return v;
2150            }
2151            else
2152                v = defRetValue;
2153            return v;
2154        }
2155        int curr;
2156        final int[] key = this.key;
2157        int pos;
2158        // The starting point.
2159        if ((curr = key[pos = (HashCommon.mix(original)) & mask]) == 0)
2160            return defRetValue;
2161        if (original == curr)
2162        {
2163            v = value[pos];
2164            idx = alterEntry(pos);
2165            putAt(replacement, v, idx);
2166            return v;
2167        }
2168        while (true) {
2169            if ((curr = key[pos = (pos + 1) & mask]) == 0)
2170                return defRetValue;
2171            if (original == curr)
2172            {
2173                v = value[pos];
2174                idx = alterEntry(pos);
2175                putAt(replacement, v, idx);
2176                return v;
2177            }
2178        }
2179    }
2180
2181    public IntVLA getMany(int... keys)
2182    {
2183        if(keys == null)
2184            return new IntVLA(1);
2185        final int len = keys.length;
2186        IntVLA vals = new IntVLA(len);
2187        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
2188            vals.add(get(keys[i]));
2189        }
2190        return vals;
2191    }
2192    /**
2193     * Changes the int at the given index to replacement while keeping replacement at the same point in the ordering.
2194     * Be aware that if replacement is present in the OrderedMap, this will still replace the given index
2195     * with replacement but will also remove the other occurrence of replacement to avoid duplicate keys. This can throw
2196     * off the expected order because the duplicate could be at any point in the ordering when it is removed. You may
2197     * want to prefer {@link #alterAtCarefully(int, int)} if you don't feel like checking by hand for whether
2198     * replacement is already present, but using this method is perfectly reasonable if you know overlaps won't happen.
2199     * @param index       an index to replace the int key at
2200     * @param replacement another int key that will replace the original at the remembered index
2201     * @return the value associated with the possibly-altered key
2202     */
2203    public int alterAt(int index, int replacement)
2204    {
2205        return alter(keyAt(index), replacement);
2206    }
2207    /**
2208     * Changes the int at the given index to replacement while keeping replacement at the same point in the ordering.
2209     * Unlike the similar method {@link #alterAt(int, int)}, this will not change this OrderedMap if replacement is
2210     * already present. To contrast, alterAt() can reduce the size of the OrderedMap if replacement is already
2211     * in the Map. If replacement is found, this returns the default return value, otherwise it switches out the index
2212     * for replacement and returns whatever value was at the index before.
2213     * @param index       an index to replace the int key at
2214     * @param replacement another int key that will replace the original at the remembered index
2215     * @return the value associated with the key at the altered index before, and replacement now
2216     */
2217    public int alterAtCarefully(int index, int replacement)
2218    {
2219        return alterCarefully(keyAt(index), replacement);
2220    }
2221
2222    /**
2223     * If the specified key is not already associated with a value, associates it with the given value
2224     * and returns that value, else returns the current value without changing anything.
2225     *
2226     * @param key   key with which the specified value is to be associated
2227     * @param value value to be associated with the specified key
2228     * @return the previous value associated with the specified key, or
2229     * {@code value} if there was no mapping for the key.
2230     */
2231    public int putIfAbsent(int key, int value) {
2232        if(containsKey(key))
2233            return get(key);         
2234        put(key, value);
2235        return value;
2236    }
2237
2238    /**
2239     * Removes the entry for the specified key only if it is currently
2240     * mapped to the specified value.
2241     *
2242     * @param key   key with which the specified value is associated
2243     * @param value value expected to be associated with the specified key
2244     * @return {@code true} if the value was removed
2245     */
2246    public boolean remove(int key, int value) {
2247        if (containsKey(key) && get(key) == value) {
2248            remove(key);
2249            return true;
2250        } else
2251            return false;
2252    }
2253
2254    /**
2255     * Replaces the entry for the specified key only if currently
2256     * mapped to the specified value. The position in the iteration
2257     * order is retained.
2258     *
2259     * @param key      key with which the specified value is associated
2260     * @param oldValue value expected to be associated with the specified key
2261     * @param newValue value to be associated with the specified key
2262     * @return {@code true} if the value was replaced
2263     */
2264    public boolean replace(int key, int oldValue, int newValue) {
2265        if (containsKey(key) && get(key) == oldValue) {
2266            put(key, newValue);
2267            return true;
2268        } else
2269            return false;
2270    }
2271
2272    /**
2273     * Replaces the entry for the specified key only if it is
2274     * currently mapped to some value. Preserves the existing key's
2275     * position in the iteration order.
2276     *
2277     * @param key   key with which the specified value is associated
2278     * @param value value to be associated with the specified key
2279     * @return the previous value associated with the specified key, or
2280     * {@code null} if there was no mapping for the key.
2281     * (A {@code null} return can also indicate that the map
2282     * previously associated {@code null} with the key.)
2283     */
2284    public int replace(int key, int value) {
2285        if (containsKey(key)) {
2286            return put(key, value);
2287        } else
2288            return defRetValue;
2289    }
2290    /**
2291     * Given alternating key and value arguments in pairs, puts each key-value pair into this OrderedMap as if by
2292     * calling {@link #put(int, int)} repeatedly for each pair. This mimics the parameter syntax used for
2293     * {@link #makeMap(int, int, int...)}, and can be used to retain that style of insertion after an
2294     * IntIntOrderedMap has been instantiated.
2295     * @param k0 the first key to add
2296     * @param v0 the first value to add
2297     * @param rest an array or vararg of keys and values in pairs; should contain alternating only int elements
2298     * @return this, after adding all viable key-value pairs given
2299     */
2300    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2301    public IntIntOrderedMap putPairs(int k0, int v0, int... rest)
2302    {
2303        if(rest == null || rest.length == 0)
2304        {
2305            put(k0, v0);
2306            return this;
2307        }
2308        put(k0, v0);
2309
2310        for (int i = 0; i < rest.length - 1; i+=2) {
2311            put(rest[i], rest[i + 1]);
2312        }
2313        return this;
2314    }
2315
2316    /**
2317     * Makes an IntIntOrderedMap using the given int keys and values in alternating key-value-key-value order. If rest
2318     * has an odd-number length, then it discards the last item. If any item in rest is not an int, this will not
2319     * compile. This is similar to the makeOM method in the Maker class, but produces an IntIntOrderedMap.
2320     * <br>
2321     * This is named makeMap to indicate that it expects key and value parameters, unlike a Set or List. This convention
2322     * may be extended to other data structures that also have static methods for instantiation.
2323     * @param k0 the first key; used to infer the types of other keys if generic parameters aren't specified.
2324     * @param v0 the first value; used to infer the types of other values if generic parameters aren't specified.
2325     * @param rest an array or vararg of keys and values in pairs; should contain only int elements
2326     * @return a freshly-made IntIntOrderedMap, using k0, v0, and the contents of rest to fill it
2327     */
2328    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2329    public static IntIntOrderedMap makeMap(int k0, int v0, int... rest)
2330    {
2331        if(rest == null || rest.length == 0)
2332        {
2333            IntIntOrderedMap om = new IntIntOrderedMap(2);
2334            om.put(k0, v0);
2335            return om;
2336        }
2337        IntIntOrderedMap om = new IntIntOrderedMap(1 + (rest.length >> 1));
2338        om.put(k0, v0);
2339
2340        for (int i = 0; i < rest.length - 1; i+=2) {
2341            try {
2342                om.put(rest[i], rest[i + 1]);
2343            }catch (ClassCastException ignored) {
2344            }
2345        }
2346        return om;
2347    }
2348
2349    /**
2350     * Makes an empty IntIntOrderedMap.This method is provided for completeness relative to makeMap() with 2 or more 
2351     * parameters.
2352     * @return an empty IntIntOrderedMap
2353     */
2354    public static IntIntOrderedMap makeMap()
2355    {
2356        return new IntIntOrderedMap();
2357    }
2358    
2359    /**
2360     * Reverses the iteration order in linear time.
2361     */
2362    public void reverse()
2363    {
2364        order.reverse();
2365    }
2366}
